Fixed by checking if inputContextManager is null before calling isDirty() on 
it.

Frederic, still using Win2K?  Get with the times :-)

Wassim, input context manager is created very early in the cycle. Why would it 
ever be null? We should examine this - it does not sound right.
*** Bug 61103 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
